title: Make Window and LayerSurface handles Clone
bump: wl_output least supported version - 4
body: This helps to populate name field when retrieving OutputInfo.

title: Simplify PointerHandler
body:
This exposes all the events in a pointer frame in one user callback instead of making them distinct function calls.  It also provides tracking of the active surface and pointer position for all events, which is useful for button press/release.

Axis (scroll) events now correctly report both discrete and absolute distances, instead of just the first of the two that was reported.

title: remove generics on XdgShellState
body: Beta 1 now allows per instance user data, so each xdg surface role should provide a delegate implementation for it's surface and type of data.

title: update to beta.1
body: layer shell is temporarily disabled until wayland-protocols-wlr is published

title: layer_shell example: use Vec::retain_mut()
body: `Vec::retain_mut()` is stabilized in Rust 1.61

title: Update to WIP 0.30 rework rework
body: This is pending on https://github.com/Smithay/wayland-rs/pull/480

title: 0.30 replace XYZError::MissingGlobals with GlobalError
body: Replace all the duplicate errors with one common error type.

title: Expose globals via State objects
body: Most RegistryHandlers expose their contained global; add it to Shm and Compositor.

title: Port AutoMemPool to 0.30-rework
body: This provides an API based on dividing the pool into slots.  It is simpler than MultiPool because it does not move slots, which might result in more memory use if there are many resize operations.

title: 0.30: Add two missing items
body:
- serials in PointerHandler
- create_region in CompositorState

title: DataOffer low level receive method & DataDevice with_dnd method
body:
This PR adds:
- a method to DataOffer which receives data to a raw file descriptor, then closes it.
- a method to DataDevice which gives access to the current DnD offer outside of a DnDEvent, which I've found useful.


I'm working on wrapping xdg windows with a layer shell window. One of the use cases I'd like to support is forwarding the clipboard contents into the embedded compositor inside the layer shell window. What I'm currently trying to do is:

1. set the compositor provided selection when the layer shell window gains keyboard focus for a seat. https://smithay.github.io/smithay/smithay/wayland/data_device/fn.set_data_device_selection.html

2. Wait for the SendSelection request in the callback I provided to init_data_device. https://docs.rs/smithay/latest/smithay/wayland/data_device/fn.init_data_device.html

3. Forward the provided fd from the SendSelection request (2) to the receive method of the data offer for the seat from (1)

Step 3 is what this PR is intended to make possible.

title: 0.30 xdg-shell: bind any version less than or equal to 3
Fix window's `wl_pointer` not releasing on drop
body:
Due to decorations manager not being destroyed, its callback was keeping
alive holding the reference to window's inner frame storage preventing
`wl_pointer`s from being released on drop.

That caused issue [1] downstream.

[1] - https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/2248

title: 0.30: add missing PartialEq for window
body: Window isn't very usable in contexts where multiple exist without a way to identify a window

title: 0.30: layer shell
body:
Shell abstractions for the layer shell. This is modeled off the xdg shell abstractions currently in 0.30.

We intentionally wrap types used by the wlr protocol since there is a future ext extension being proposed. We do not implement the ext extension (but it was considered during the design).

title: 0.30: update to new alpha and pin alpha version
body: Trivial, going to merge when CI says it builds.

title: 0.30 xdg: idea to make configures better
body:
Vast improvements to `Window` abstraction in xdg shell handling for SCTK.

Changes include:
- Moving configure to `WindowHandler`, each derivation of `XdgSurface` is expected to provide it's own handler method for configures.
- Window creation uses a builder
- Creating an XdgSurface, returned as a `XdgShellSurface` is now possible to allow external implementations of protocols which extend `XdgSurface`.
- Better server side decoration handling
- General cleanup of window data

title: Multipool (rework)
body: Addresses the last review on https://github.com/Smithay/client-toolkit/pull/220

title: Add touch support
body:
This adds a new handler for touch events. Since most touch events are
buffered until a frame event is sent, this buffering is performed
internally similar to the pointer implementation.

The implementation supports wl_touch up to version 6, including the
touch point shape feature.

Fixes #169.

title: xdg: decode states correctly
body: This fixes a bug that I introduced during the rewrite...

title: Use fully-qualified Result in macro definitions
xdg-shell (0.30): split windowing out of XdgShellState
body: This splits the windows out of `XdgShellState` and into a new `XdgWindowState`. This makes the xdg shell abstractions much more modular and removes the need to have `delgate_xdg_shell` require `delegate_xdg_window`.

title: Multipool (rebase)
body: Improvements on the MultiPool.

title: keyboard (0.30): WIP keyboard and keymap impl
body:
~~The FFI is quite a mess imo and is generally a copy of the old FFI with a few tweaks I've made to try to tame some bits. Ideally we would rework the FFI implementation quite a bit since it has way to many hidden states.~~

~~The keyboard implementation itself was already pretty close to done, just needed to wire up the keymap logic.~~

Brand new keyboard implementation. SCTK now requires the `xkbcommon` feature to use the keyboard implementation (which is optional) and libxkbcommon to be installed on the system.

Repeating event source will come in another pull request.

title: pointer: refactor api and fix bugs (0.30)
body:
The pointer implementation was not well designed when I first wrote it. As well as untested.

This is a much more well designed implementation that also handles some things I overlooked.

body: Pointer abstractions do need testing, but are essentially complete. So this macro is being added to allow testing in smithay.

This also sets the `missing_debug_implementations` lint to warn
